Reply: 
If you have to travel frequently, it's important to establish a routine and stick to it as much as possible. This can help your body adjust to the time changes more quickly and make jet lag less of a problem. Some tips for managing jet lag on a regular basis include:
1. Establish a consistent sleep schedule, even on weekends.
2. Stay hydrated and eat nutritious foods to help your body adjust to the new time zone.
3. Try to get out and get some fresh air and sunlight when you arrive at your destination.
4. Use blackout curtains or room darkening shades to help create a sleep-conducive environment.
5. Consider using a sleep mask or earplugs to block out noise and help you sleep.
